attributes.additional_details: Parcels are dumped on the doorstep, in full view of potential thieves. Complaints procedures are a joke. If courier companies can’t ring the bell and wait for an answer, and if there is no answer then try a neighbour or try again next day, then they should be fined by a regulator. Royal Mail manages, in the main, to deliver parcels direct to the customer or leave a card offering a redelivery or collection. Couriers should be obliged to do the same.
attributes.background: The standard of parcel deliveries by couriers has declined substantially in recent years. The normal procedure now seems to be: Drop the parcel on the doorstep and leave. They don’t even ring the doorbell, let alone wait for you to answer the door.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/642095
